work.p: This manuscript is a draft of Whitman's prose introduction to the poem "Prayer of Columbus," which was published first in Harper's Magazine in March, 1874.

titleStmt.title: It is in itself
a machine readable transcription

notesStmt.note: This manuscript was probably composed in late 1873 or early 1874, when Whitman was working on the poem "Prayer of Columbus."

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: "Prayer of Columbus" Fragment
bibl.orgName: Amherst College Archives and Special Collections
bibl.note: Transcribed from our own digital image of original manuscript.

body.head: It is in itself
body.p: * It is in itself & with its preludes & surroundings & preludes one of those Tragedies, which poems and plays cannot make more piteous & majestic.—See indeed as in some such great grand tragedy indeed , the tall figure of Columbus, on the walking alone apart the those shores, washed by the far Antilles' waves, and hear—for who can doubt that his soul's expression took quite substantively such form—the prayer he utters:
